body:
Hi Everybody,



I imported some buildings from an urban landscape from GIS to Rhino. 

The buildings are located in their real locations (x,y). I need to use the real time radiation analysis tool. I set the breps but the tool does not work. However, when I move those buildings to the 0,0 coordinate, the tool works. How can I fix this? 

P.S. the building layer is attached.



thanks,

Mehdi
topic: I imported my buildings from GIS; Real Time Radiation Analysis Doesn't Work; Coordinate problem

replies.body:
Hi Mehdi,
This is weird if this doesn't work at your end.
I tried your file, as is, and it works fine. Maybe the problem is with the grid size. You have a large ground. I tested with 10 m grid.
-A.

Thanks Abraham,



You are right. I changed the grid size to 10 and it works well now. I really appreciate your help.



Best,

Mehdi

Hi Mehdi,

I remember this problem happening to me a while a go but I did not have time to look into it or post on it.  I also had some complicated site geometry and the grid size was also small.  Now that I have seen this happen in two cases, it definitely smells like a bug to me.

Could you post the GH file with the exact grid size and specifications that are causing this to fail?

As Mostapha wrote the radiation components, I feel that we should let him take a look at it first and, if he ends up being too busy after the next few days, I will look into fixing it.

-Chris

Hi Chris,



I uploaded the GH file. I used 1 as the grid size and it did not work but 10 works pretty well.

Mehdi
